00021 #ifdef  OS_CPU_GLOBALS
00022 #define OS_CPU_EXT
00023 #else
00024 #define OS_CPU_EXT  extern
00025 #endif
00026 
00027 /*
00028 *********************************************************************************************************
00029 *                                              DATA TYPES
00030 *                                         (Compiler Specific)
00031 *********************************************************************************************************
00032 */
00033 
00034 typedef unsigned char  BOOLEAN;
00035 typedef unsigned char  INT8U;                    /* Unsigned  8 bit quantity                           */
00036 typedef signed   char  INT8S;                    /* Signed    8 bit quantity                           */
00037 typedef unsigned int   INT16U;                   /* Unsigned 16 bit quantity                           */
00038 typedef signed   int   INT16S;                   /* Signed   16 bit quantity                           */
00039 typedef unsigned long  INT32U;                   /* Unsigned 32 bit quantity                           */
00040 typedef signed   long  INT32S;                   /* Signed   32 bit quantity                           */
00041 typedef float          FP32;                     /* Single precision floating point                    */
00042 typedef double         FP64;                     /* Double precision floating point                    */
00043 
00044 typedef unsigned int   OS_STK;                   /* Each stack entry is 16-bit wide                    */
00045 typedef unsigned int   OS_CPU_SR;                /* Define size of CPU status register (SR = 16 bits)  */
00046 
00047 /* 
00048 *********************************************************************************************************
00049 *                                             TI MSP430
00050 *
00051 * Method #1:  Disable/Enable interrupts using simple instructions.  After critical section, interrupts
00052 *             will be enabled even if they were disabled before entering the critical section.
00053 *
00054 * Method #2:  Disable/Enable interrupts by preserving the state of interrupts.  In other words, if 
00055 *             interrupts were disabled before entering the critical section, they will be disabled when
00056 *             leaving the critical section.
00057 *             NOT IMPLEMENTED!
00058 *
00059 * Method #3:  Disable/Enable interrupts by preserving the state of interrupts.  Generally speaking you
00060 *             would store the state of the interrupt disable flag in the local variable 'cpu_sr' and then
00061 *             disable interrupts.  'cpu_sr' is allocated in all of uC/OS-II's functions that need to 
00062 *             disable interrupts.  You would restore the interrupt disable state by copying back 'cpu_sr'
00063 *             into the CPU's status register.
00064 *********************************************************************************************************
00065 */
00066 #define  OS_CRITICAL_METHOD    3
00067 
00068 #if      OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 1
00069 #define  OS_ENTER_CRITICAL()            _DINT()                           /* Disable interrupts                        */
00070 #define  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL()                     _EINT()                           /* Enable  interrupts                        */
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #if      OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 2
00074 #define  OS_ENTER_CRITICAL()                              /* Disable interrupts                        */
00075 #define  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL()                               /* Enable  interrupts                        */
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 #if      OS_CRITICAL_METHOD == 3
00079 #define  OS_ENTER_CRITICAL()  (cpu_sr = OSCPUSaveSR())    /* Disable interrupts                        */
00080 #define  OS_EXIT_CRITICAL()   (OSCPURestoreSR(cpu_sr))    /* Enable  interrupts                        */
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 /*
00084 *********************************************************************************************************
00085 *                                             MSP430
00086 *********************************************************************************************************
00087 */
00088 
00089 #define  OS_STK_GROWTH        1                       /* Stack grows from HIGH to LOW memory on MSP430 */
00090 
00091 #define  OS_TASK_SW()         OSCtxSw()                           /* Task level context switch routine             */
00092 
00093 /*
00094 *********************************************************************************************************
00095 *                                         GLOBAL VARIABLES
00096 *********************************************************************************************************
00097 */
00098 
00099 OS_CPU_EXT  OS_STK  *OSISRStkPtr;                    /* Pointer to top-of ISR stack                    */
00100 
00101 /*
00102 *********************************************************************************************************
00103 *                                           PROTOTYPES
00104 *********************************************************************************************************
00105 */
00106 
00107 OS_CPU_SR  OSCPUSaveSR(void);
00108 void       OSCPURestoreSR(OS_CPU_SR cpu_sr);
